Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a World in which all of the entities belong to the World exist.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new World of size lenX by lenY.

      Creates a new World of size lenX by lenY.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int lenX,
             int lenY)
        Creates a new World of size lenX by lenY. The dimensions must be positive; otherwise, it will throw an exception. If the given dimensions are valid, it initiates its Map field as an empty 2D array of the given dimensions. It also initiates its random field to prepare for randomizing its actions. Additionally, if this constructor is used, the showAll variable is true by default.
        Parameters:
        lenX - The x-dimension of this World. Must be positive.
        lenY - The y-dimension of this World. Must be positive.

      • World

        public World(int lenX,
             int lenY,
             boolean showAll)
        Creates a new World of size lenX by lenY. The dimensions must be positive; otherwise, it will throw an exception. If the given dimensions are valid, it initiates its Map field as an empty 2D array of the given dimensions. It also initiates its random field to prepare for randomizing its actions. Additionally, the showAll field takes on the provided valid.
        Parameters:
        lenX - The x-dimension of this World. Must be positive.
        lenY - The y-dimension of this World. Must be positive.
        showAll - A boolean value used to determine whether or not all of the actions of this World's Entities should be displayed in the terminal as text.

      • initialSpawn

        public void initialSpawn(int numCarnivores,
                         int numHerbivores,
                         int numPlants,
                         int numRocks,
                         int numTrees)
        Initializes this World with a given number of Carnivores, Herbivores, Plants, Rocks, and Trees. The Entities are placed in random Locations in this World.
        Parameters:
        numCarnivores - The provided number of Carnivores this World will start with.
        numHerbivores - The provided number of Herbivores this World will start with.
        numPlants - The provided number of Plants this World will start with.
        numRocks - The provided number of Rocks this World will start with.
        numTrees - The provided number of Trees this World will start with.

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Location loc,
                      Entity e)
        Places a given Entity at a given Location in this World. If the Entity is an Animal or a Plant, it will also add it to the respective ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        loc - The given Location where the Entity should be placed in. Must be valid; otherwise, it will throw an exception.
        e - The given Entity which is to be placed in the given Location. Cannot be null; otherwise, it will throw an exception.

      • spawnPlant

        public void spawnPlant()
        Places new plants at random, empty locations in this World.

      • exhaustiveBFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<Location> exhaustiveBFS(Location start,
                                                   char target,
                                                   double maxDist,
                                                   boolean exhaustive)
        Searches for all instances of the entity matching the given character target within a given distance maxDist. Starts the breadth first search at the given Location start and searches in a flood fill as long as the distance of the current location from the start location is less than maxDist. If boolean exhaustive is false, the search stops at the first found instance. Otherwise, returns all found instances in the given area.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting location of the breadth first search
        target - The character of the type that is being searched for
        maxDist - The maximum distance that the search is allowed to look
        exhaustive - Whether or not to find all instances (true) or only one (false)
        Returns:
        An array of found instances given the parameters and the state of this World

      • exhaustiveBFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<Location> exhaustiveBFS(Location start,
                                                   char[] targets,
                                                   double maxDist,
                                                   boolean exhaustive)
        Searches for all instances of the entity matching the any of the given characters in array targets within a given distance maxDist. Starts the breadth first search at the given Location start and searches in a flood fill as long as the distance of the current location from the start location is less than maxDist. If boolean exhaustive is false, the search stops at the first found instance. Otherwise, returns all found instances in the given area.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting location of the breadth first search
        targets - The array of characters of the types that are being searched for
        maxDist - The maximum distance that the search is allowed to look
        exhaustive - Whether or not to find all instances (true) or only one (false)
        Returns:
        An array of found instances given the parameters and the state of this World

      • updateAnimals

        public void updateAnimals()
        Iterates through a random permutation of the ArrayList of Animals so that each Animal can have an equally likely chance of acting next (Animals that were added to the ArrayList first are not prioritized over other Animals). Each Animal gets to act at least once during this World's clock cycle. Carnivores are more likely to act twice in one clock cycle (70%). All animals have an additional chance of acting one more time (30%).

      • updatePlants

        public void updatePlants()
        Iterates through the ArrayList of Plants and allows each Plant to perform an action.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates this World. It increments its clock before having all of its Entities update themselves. It also spawns new plants to provide food for the Animals that can eat them, thus keeping the World sustainable.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(Location loc)
        Determines whether or not the given Location in this World is empty.
        Parameters:
        loc - The given Location in which one wants to check if it is empty.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not the given Location in this World is empty. True if it is empty. False otherwise.

        y - The y-coordinates of this World.
        Returns:

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Location loc)
        Determines whether or not the given Location is valid in this world. The Location is valid if it is located within the boundaries of this World.
        Parameters:
        loc - The given Location in which one wants to check the validity of.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not the given Location is valid. True if it is valid. False otherwise.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(int x,
                       int y)
        Determines whether or not the given coordinates are valid in this World. They are valid if they are located within the boundaries of this World.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of this World.
        y - The y-coordinate of this World.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not the given coordinates are a valid Location in this World. True if they are valid. False otherwise.

      • hasAnimals

        public boolean hasAnimals()
        Determines whether or not there are Animals in this World.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not there exists Animals in this World. True if there are still Animals in this World. False otherwise.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a String that represents what this World's Map looks like. It contains the character representations of the Entities that are located at each location in the world. If there is no Entity in a location, a '.' is printed instead.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of the Map of this World.
